transportAdvice: The compact UNESCO-listed old town is very walkable, and bicycles or scooters are widely available to rent for exploring further afield. Tuk-tuks are the main form of local taxi transport and are readily available for trips to waterfalls, the night market, and surrounding villages.

weather.description: Cool, dry, and sunny — the peak of the cool season with comfortable days and chilly nights.
Warm and dry with clear skies, ideal conditions for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Temperatures rise noticeably and haze from agricultural burning can reduce visibility.
Hot and increasingly humid as the wet season approaches, with occasional early showers.
The rainy season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon downpours and lush greenery emerging.
Heavy and regular rainfall with overcast skies, though showers often clear by evening.
One of the wettest months; the Mekong and Nam Khan rivers rise significantly.
Continued heavy rain and high humidity; waterfalls are at their most dramatic and full.
Still very wet with a risk of flooding along the riverbanks as water levels peak.
Rain begins to ease and the landscape is intensely green; a transitional and pleasant month.
The dry season returns with cooler temperatures and clear skies — excellent for travel.
Cool and dry with crisp mornings and comfortable afternoons, one of the most pleasant months to visit.
